content.stone1: Stones with lots of tiny pores (like limestone), frequently found in ancient monuments are more vulnerable to corrosion because they act like little sponges!
content.stone2: These porous stones absorb moisture, pollutants, and even acidic rain more easily than denser stones, this mechanism speeds up weathering.
content.stone3: So, while a monument may look strong and solid, if it's made of porous stone, it's actually fighting a secret battle everyday!
